column4: Do I need to change unallocated HD space to the same Ext3 format as Ubuntu in order to combine the partitions?
you using lvm?
lvm?
linux volume manager
GPart
are the partitions side by side?
my linux partition is broken up into 3 parts.  there's 2 2 gig parts and then the swap.  the unallocated is right above the first 2 gig part
which I don't think is the actual ubuntu
well, you should be able to delete the second part, then resize the first, though be carefull
I want to know how to the combine the allocated with the actual ubuntu partition
One of the partitions is labeled Extended...the other is EXt3 and the last is swap
my last suggestion should result in you having one big partition, were you to want to combine them look into lvm
though lvm would be pointless from what i have heard of you case
All I want to know is how to combine an unallocated partition with my EXT3 partition...do I need to convert the unallocated to EXT3 in order to combine them?
no, just expand the first is the unallocated is right beside it
expand = resize
It's above it...they are listed vertically
i have done that before with gparted, worked fine
what partition program are you using, what verioin of ubuntu?
Gpart and 9.04
Do I want to extend the part of the partition labeled "Extended" or "EXT3"
